Does the Argument Contain a ggplot2 Scale?

Source: R/checkScale.R
checkScale.Rd

Does the Argument Contain a ggplot2 Scale?

checkScale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE)

check_scale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE)

testScale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE)

test_scale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE)

assertScale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE, .var.name = checkmate::vname(x),
  add = NULL)

assert_scale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE, .var.name = checkmate::vname(x),
  add = NULL)

expect_scale(x, scale = c("continuous", "discrete"), aes = c("colour",
  "fill"), null.ok = FALSE, info = NULL, label = vname(x))

Arguments

x

Object.
scale

string. Type of scale, either "continuous" or "discrete".
aes

string. Aesthetic mapping, either "colour" or "fill". Note that ggplot2 prefers British spelling, so we're enforcing that convention here.
null.ok

logical(1). If set to TRUE, x may also be NULL.
.var.name

character(1). Name of the checked object to print in assertions.
add

AssertCollection. Extra information to be included in the message for the testthat reporter. See testthat::expect_that().
info

character. Extra information to be included in the message for the testthat reporter. See testthat::expect_that().
label

character(1). Name of the checked object to print in messages.

Value

  • boolean flag for are/has/is*() functions.

  • Stop on error for assert*() functions (see stop() or stopifnot() for details).

Examples

library(ggplot2)

colour_c <- scale_colour_gradient(low = "red", high = "blue")
class(colour_c)
#> [1] "ScaleContinuous" "Scale"           "ggproto"         "gg"             

colour_d <- scale_colour_manual(values = c("red", "blue"))
class(colour_d)
#> [1] "ScaleDiscrete" "Scale"         "ggproto"       "gg"           

fill_c <- scale_fill_gradient(low = "red", high = "blue")
class(fill_c)
#> [1] "ScaleContinuous" "Scale"           "ggproto"         "gg"             

fill_d <- scale_fill_manual(values = c("red", "blue"))
class(fill_d)
#> [1] "ScaleDiscrete" "Scale"         "ggproto"       "gg"           

checkScale(x = colour_c, scale = "continuous", aes = "colour")
#> [1] TRUE
checkScale(x = colour_d, scale = "discrete", aes = "colour")
#> [1] TRUE
checkScale(x = fill_c, scale = "continuous", aes = "fill")
#> [1] TRUE
checkScale(x = fill_d, scale = "discrete", aes = "fill")
#> [1] TRUE
